project_description: A simple Flutter app using the Cubit pattern for state management. The app includes a login screen and a home screen with a logout button.
architecture_overview: The app follows a modular architecture with a clear separation of concerns, using Cubit for state management. Each feature has its own directory with screens, cubits, and models.

files.name: lib/main.dart
files.description: The entry point of the application. It sets up the initial routes and provides the necessary Cubits using BlocProvider.

methods.name: main

methods.description: Builds the initial widget tree for the application.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> LoginScreen: open
LoginScreen -> AuthCubit: login(email, password)
AuthCubit -> AuthState: Authenticated
AuthCubit --> HomeScreen: navigate
HomeScreen -> AuthCubit: logout
AuthCubit -> AuthState: Unauthenticated
AuthCubit --> LoginScreen: navigate
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using Cubit. The AuthCubit manages the authentication state, transitioning between AuthInitial, Authenticated, and Unauthenticated states based on user actions. The state changes trigger UI updates in the LoginScreen and HomeScreen widgets.
navigation_flow: The app starts at the LoginScreen. Upon successful login, the user is navigated to the HomeScreen. The HomeScreen has a logout button, which, when pressed, navigates the user back to the LoginScreen.
